title: The Expanding Universe
scientific_fact: In 1929, Edwin Hubble discovered that the universe is not static but expanding. Galaxies are moving away from us, a fact confirmed by the redshift in their light spectra, matching the Quranic description of 'expanding' the heavens.

title: Mountains as Stakes
verse_arabic: أَلَمْ نَجْعَلِ الْأَرْضَ مِهَادًا . وَالْجِبَالَ أَوْتَادًا
scientific_fact: Modern geology confirms that mountains have deep roots comprising over 80% of their mass, extending deep into the lithosphere. These roots act like pegs or stakes ('Awtad'), stabilizing the Earth's crust against tectonic plate movement.

title: The Protective Ceiling
verse_arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا السَّمَاءَ سَقْفًا مَحْفُوظًا ۖ وَهُمْ عَنْ آيَاتِهَا مُعْرِضُونَ
scientific_fact: Earth's atmosphere and magnetic field serve as a 'protected roof,' shielding life from lethal cosmic rays, solar flares, and meteorites. Without this protective layer, life on Earth would be impossible.

title: Embryology: The 'Alaqah' Stage
verse_arabic: ثُمَّ خَلَقْنَا النُّطْفَةَ عَلَقَةً فَخَلَقْنَا الْعَلَقَةَ مُضْغَةً
scientific_fact: The Quran describes the embryo as 'Alaqah' (a leech-like substance, suspended thing, or blood clot). Modern embryology confirms the early embryo looks remarkably like a leech and obtains nutrients from the mother's blood, just like a leech.

title: Origin of Life in Water
verse_arabic: وَجَعَلْنَا مِنَ الْمَاءِ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ حَيٍّ ۖ أَفَلَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
scientific_fact: Cytoplasm, the basic substance of the cell, is approx. 80% water. Every living organism is predominantly made of water, a fact discovered only after the invention of the microscope, yet stated 1400 years ago.

title: Iron Sent Down
verse_arabic: وَأَنْزَلْنَا الْحَدِيدَ فِيهِ بَأْسٌ شَدِيدٌ وَمَنَافِعُ لِلنَّاسِ
scientific_fact: Iron is not natural to earth; it was sent down in giant meteorites. The energy required to fuse iron is greater than the sun's capacity, meaning it originated from distant supernovae.

title: Orbits of Celestial Bodies
verse_arabic: لَا الشَّمْسُ يَنْبَغِي لَهَا أَنْ تُدْرِكَ الْقَمَرَ وَلَا اللَّيْلُ سَابِقُ النَّهَارِ ۚ وَكُلٌّ فِي فَلَكٍ يَسْبَحُونَ
scientific_fact: The Quran states that the Sun and Moon swim in their own orbits. We now know the Sun orbits the center of the Milky Way, taking approx. 225 million years to complete one revolution.

title: The Barrier Between Seas
verse_arabic: مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ يَلْتَقِيَانِ . بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخٌ لَا يَبْغِيَانِ
scientific_fact: Oceanography confirms that there is a barrier where distinct seas meet (e.g., Mediterranean and Atlantic). They maintain their own salinity, temperature, and density, not mixing immediately.

title: Darkness in Deep Oceans
verse_arabic: أَوْ كَظُلُمَاتٍ فِي بَحْرٍ لُجِّيٍّ يَغْشَاهُ مَوْجٌ مِنْ فَوْقِهِ مَوْجٌ
scientific_fact: Below 200m in the ocean, there is almost complete darkness. The verse also mentions 'internal waves' (waves above waves), a phenomenon discovered only recently in deep oceanography.

title: The Frontal Lobe and Lying
scientific_fact: The Quran connects the 'forelock' (nasiyah) to lying and sin. Modern neuroscience identifies the prefrontal cortex as the area responsible for decision making, planning, and lying.

title: Pain Receptors in Skin
verse_arabic: كُلَّمَا نَضِجَتْ جُلُودُهُمْ بَدَّلْنَاهُمْ جُلُودًا غَيْرَهَا لِيَذُوقُوا الْعَذَابَ
scientific_fact: The verse states that skin will be replaced so they 'taste' the punishment. We now know that pain receptors are located in the skin; deep burns destroy these receptors, numbing the pain.

title: The Big Bang
verse_arabic: أَنَّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ كَانَتَا رَتْقًا فَفَتَقْنَاهُمَا
scientific_fact: The universe began as a single point (singularity) and then expanded. The Quran describes the heavens and earth as a 'joined entity' (ratq) that was then 'separated' (fataq).

title: Smoke in the Early Universe
verse_arabic: ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ إِلَى السَّمَاءِ وَهِيَ دُخَانٌ
scientific_fact: Before stars formed, the universe was an opaque cloud of hot gas. The Quran uses the word 'Dukhan' (smoke), which accurately describes the hot, gaseous state of the early universe.

title: Wind Pollination
scientific_fact: The verse describes winds as 'fertilizing'. Science confirms that wind plays a crucial role in pollination for many plants and also in the formation of rain clouds.

title: The Water Cycle
verse_arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ أَنْزَلَ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً فَسَلَكَهُ يَنَابِيعَ فِي الْأَرْضِ
scientific_fact: The Quran accurately describes the water cycle: rain falling, seeping into the ground, and forming springs. This concept was not fully understood in Europe until the 16th century.

title: Fingerprints
verse_arabic: بَلَىٰ قَادِرِينَ عَلَىٰ أَنْ نُسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُ
scientific_fact: The Quran emphasizes God's ability to reconstruct even the fingertips. We now know that fingerprints are unique to every individual and are a key method of identification.

title: Female Bees Worker
verse_arabic: وَأَوْحَىٰ رَبُّكَ إِلَى النَّحْلِ أَنِ اتَّخِذِي مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا...
scientific_fact: The Arabic verbs used for the bee in these verses are in the female gender. Science confirms that the worker bees who build the hive and gather nectar are females, not males.

title: Spider's Web Fragility
scientific_fact: The Quran compares those who take protectors other than Allah to a spider's web, calling it the weakest of houses. While the silk is strong, the 'house' (social structure) is often frail, with females sometimes killing males.

title: Ants Communication
verse_arabic: قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَا أَيُّهَا النَّمْلُ ادْخُلُوا مَسَاكِنَكُمْ
scientific_fact: The Quran describes an ant warning others of Solomon's army. Modern entomology confirms that ants communicate via complex chemical signals (pheromones) and sound to warn of danger.

title: Sleep and Rest
scientific_fact: 'Subata' implies cutting off for rest. Sleep disconnects us from awareness to recharge the body and brain, a physiological necessity for survival and mental health.

title: Spherical Shape of Earth
verse_arabic: يُكَوِّرُ اللَّيْلَ عَلَى النَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ النَّهَارَ عَلَى اللَّيْلِ
scientific_fact: The word 'Yukawwiru' means to wrap around a spherical object (like a turban). This description fits the day and night wrapping around the spherical Earth.

title: Haman and Ancient Egypt
verse_arabic: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَا هَامَانُ ابْنِ لِي صَرْحًا
scientific_fact: The Quran mentions Haman as a builder for Pharaoh. Hieroglyphs decoded recently identify 'Haman' as the head of quarry workers, a fact unknown at the time of the revelation.

title: Lowest Point on Earth
scientific_fact: The battle between Persia and Rome happened near the Dead Sea. The Quran calls it 'Adna al-Ard', meaning the lowest land. The Dead Sea basin is indeed the lowest point on dry land on Earth.

title: Pairs in Creation
scientific_fact: The Quran states that all things are created in pairs. This applies not just to gender, but to matter/antimatter, forces (positive/negative), and even day/night.

title: Preservation of Pharaoh
verse_arabic: فَالْيَوْمَ نُنَجِّيكَ بِبَدَنِكَ لِتَكُونَ لِمَنْ خَلْفَكَ آيَةً
scientific_fact: God promised to preserve Pharaoh's body as a sign. The mummified body of Merneptah (often associated with the Exodus) was discovered in 1898, remarkably preserved.

title: Clouds: Heavy with Rain
scientific_fact: The Quran describes clouds as 'heavy.' A typical cumulus cloud can weigh up to 500,000 kilograms (1.1 million pounds), yet it floats in the air.

title: Milk Production
verse_arabic: نُسْقِيكُمْ مِمَّا فِي بُطُونِهِ مِنْ بَيْنَ فَرْثٍ وَدَمٍ لَبَنًا خَالِصًا
scientific_fact: The Quran describes milk forming 'between chyme and blood.' Physiology confirms that nutrients are absorbed from digested food (chyme) into the blood, which then supplies the mammary glands.

title: The Sun's Motion
scientific_fact: The verse says the sun 'runs' to a resting place. Solar Apex theory confirms the sun is moving towards a specific point in the constellation Hercules at 12 miles per second.

title: Date Palms and Birth
verse_arabic: وَهُزِّي إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ النَّخْلَةِ تُسَاقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا
scientific_fact: Mary was told to eat dates during labor. Dates contain oxytocin-like substances that facilitate labor and sugars that provide rapid energy, ideal for childbirth.

title: Hearing Before Sight
scientific_fact: The Quran consistently mentions hearing before sight. Embryology confirms that the inner ear develops before the eyes, and a fetus can hear sounds in the womb before it can see.

title: Stars as Guides
scientific_fact: Stars have been the primary tool for navigation for millennia. The Quran highlights this precise function, accurate for both land and sea travel.

title: Diversity of Colors
verse_arabic: وَمَا ذَرَأَ لَكُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ مُخْتَلِفًا أَلْوَانُهُ
scientific_fact: The Quran celebrates the diversity of creation's colors. Biodiversity is crucial for ecosystem resilience; the variety of species and forms ensures life's continuity.

title: Vegetation Reviving Earth
scientific_fact: Deserts can bloom rapidly after rain. The 'resurrection' of dead land portrays the biological truth of dormant seeds waiting for water to germinate.

title: Honey: Healing for People
scientific_fact: The Quran refers to honey as healing. Modern medicine confirms honey has powerful antibacterial, antifungal, and anti-inflammatory properties.

title: Fault Lines and Cracks
scientific_fact: The Quran swears by the 'Earth which splits'. This perfectly describes the crust's fault lines and tectonic plate boundaries, crucial for geothermal venting and the carbon cycle.

title: Animal Communities
scientific_fact: The Quran states animals live in communities like humans. Ethology (animal behavior) confirms that animals have complex social structures, languages, and hierarchies.

title: Moonlight is Reflected
verse_arabic: وَجَعَلَ الْقَمَرَ فِيهِنَّ نُورًا وَجَعَلَ الشَّمْسَ سِرَاجًا
scientific_fact: The Quran calls the Sun a 'lamp' (Siraj - source of light) and the Moon a 'light' (Nur - reflected light). This distinction accurately describes that the moon only confirms light.

title: Flight of Birds
verse_arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الطَّيْرِ فَوْقَهُمْ صَافَّاتٍ وَيَقْبِضْنَ
scientific_fact: The verse mentions birds spreading and folding their wings. Aerodynamics studies show how these specific movements generate lift and thrust, managed by instinct.

title: Bone and Muscle Development
scientific_fact: The Quran states bones form first, then are clothed with flesh. Embryology indicates that cartilage models of bones form before the muscles migrate and wrap around them.

title: Relativity of Time
verse_arabic: وَإِنَّ يَوْمًا عِنْدَ رَبِّكَ كَأَلْفِ سَنَةٍ مِمَّا تَعُدُّونَ
scientific_fact: The Quran suggests time is relative, not absolute ('a day is like a thousand years'). Einstein's theory of relativity proved that time varies depending on speed and gravity.

title: Blood Circulation (Implied)
scientific_fact: The call to look 'within yourselves' has led Muslim scientists like Ibn al-Nafis to discover pulmonary circulation centuries before Harvey.

title: Reduction of Earth's Edges
scientific_fact: Some interpret this as the polar flattening of the Earth (it's not a perfect sphere). Others see it as land erosion or sea level rise. Both fit the description of reducing edges.

title: Stars Dying
scientific_fact: 'Hawa' implies falling or collapsing. Stars eventually collapse (supernova, black hole) or fade. The Quran swears by this event, highlighting its significance.

title: Weight of an Atom
scientific_fact: The Quran refers to the 'weight of an atom' (Dharrah). It acknowledged the existence of the smallest particle long before atomic theory was developed.

title: Fire from Green Trees
verse_arabic: الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمْ مِنَ الشَّجَرِ الْأَخْضَرِ نَارًا
scientific_fact: This refers to the conversion of solar energy into chemical energy (carbon) via photosynthesis in green plants, which is then released as fire/energy when burned.

title: Pulsars (The Knocking Star)
scientific_fact: 'At-Tariq' means the knocker. Pulsars are rotating neutron stars that emit a beam of radiation, creating a precise 'knocking' sound when converted to audio.

title: Layers of the Atmosphere
scientific_fact: The Quran mentions seven heavens/layers. Science classifies the atmosphere into distinct layers (Troposphere, Stratosphere, Mesosphere, etc.), protecting the Earth.

title: Shadow Movement
verse_arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ
scientific_fact: The Quran invites reflection on how shadows stretch. The movement of shadows is a direct result of the Earth's rotation relative to the sun, a complex astronomical motion.

title: Sperm Drops
scientific_fact: The Quran specifies that humans are created from a drop of sperm (maniy), not the entire fluid. Science confirms only one sperm out of millions is needed for fertilization.

title: Land and Sea Ratio (Implied)
scientific_fact: The word 'Sea' appears 32 times and 'Land' 13 times in the Quran. The ratio (32/45) is approx 71%, which corresponds to the proportion of the Earth's surface covered by water.

title: Olive and Fig
scientific_fact: The Quran swears by the Fig and Olive. Both are nutritional powerhouses. Modern science highlights the Mediterranean diet (rich in olives) as one of the healthiest.

title: Cleanliness and Wudu
verse_arabic: إِذَا قُمْتُمْ إِلَى الصَّلَاةِ فَاغْسِلُوا وُجُوهَكُمْ
scientific_fact: Regular washing of exposed parts (hands, face, feet) 5 times a day reduces the spread of germs and diseases significantly, a hygienic practice prescribed 1400 years ago.

title: Hearts Finding Rest
scientific_fact: Meditation and remembrance (Dhikr) reduce cortisol levels and stress. The Quran prescribed this spiritual practice for mental peace long before modern psychology.

title: The End of the World
scientific_fact: The Quran describes the sun being 'wound round' and losing light. Astrophysics predicts our sun will eventually become a Red Giant and then a White Dwarf, effectively dying out.

title: Breastfeeding Duration
scientific_fact: The Quran recommends breastfeeding for two full years. The WHO today recommends breastfeeding up to two years or beyond for optimal child health.
